title: World Cup qualifiers, WSL updates and football news – matchday live
summary: Emillia Hawkins will host a pre-event buildup and discussion. She will provide insights and analysis ahead of the day’s activities. Tune in for expert commentary and anticipation of what’s to come.

title: Gaza ceasefire live: aid relief scaled up as Hamas confirms it will begin releasing Israeli hostages on Monday morning
summary: Israel's military has announced the completion of the first phase of its withdrawal operations. This move comes in preparation for a peace summit scheduled for Monday in Egypt. The developments signal a potential shift in the ongoing regional tensions.

title: Thousands attend pro-Palestine rallies across Australia as organisers vow to keep protesting after Gaza ceasefire
summary: Sydney organizers affirmed their commitment to continuing protests for a free Palestine amid ongoing conflicts. Participants voiced hope that a potential US-brokered deal could lead to an end to the violence and suffering. The protests highlight a strong sentiment for justice and peace in the region.

title: Parliamentary staff of colour earn £2,000 less than white colleagues, study suggests
summary: A report from the GMB union reveals significant pay disparities among employees, highlighting wage gaps for women, disabled individuals, and LGBTQ+ staff, including trans and non-binary workers. The findings underscore ongoing issues of inequality in the workplace. The report calls for urgent attention to address these disparities.

title: It can get worse: Blackpool’s latest defeat recalls Mick McCarthy meme
summary: Blackpool started the season with optimism under manager Steve Bruce but are now without a manager. Following their recent loss to Stockport, they find themselves in the relegation zone, sitting second from bottom in League One. The team's hopes for a turnaround look bleak as they navigate this difficult period.
